page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is a rural area with only small villages and isolated farms.The rolling countryside consists of mostly large ploughed or cultivated fields, divided by natural hedges or small ditches.The area around West Wickham and the old airfield form a kind of plateau and is a watershed. Several small deciduous woods are dotted across the land.Remains of disused chalkpits can be found in some fields. Eye-catching buildings are West Wratting Windmill, a restored smock- mill standing on West Wratting hill, West Wratting Hall and the recently rebuilt cattle pound, listed as an ancient monument.West Wickham church, with its beautiful blue clockface tow- ers high above the village.Worth ment- ioning are the newly restored aircraft hangers on the old airfield, they are used by the E.E.C. to store grain.
